trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_SEQ_00<tab>Alphinaud seems eager to review your journey thus far.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_TODO_00<tab>Speak with the dirigible attendant.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_TODO_01<tab>Speak with the dirigible attendant.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Erenville.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Erenville again.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_TODO_04<tab>Speak with Alphinaud.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_001<tab>I'm sure the others will be along shortly. I do hope everyone has rested well.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_002<tab>Now that we have refreshed ourselves somewhat, let us consider all claimants as they currently stand.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_003<tab>Zoraal Ja and Koana have completed every feat thus far and hold five keystones apiece.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_004<tab>Wuk Lamat would be equal with them but for Bakool Ja Ja's thievery, which has left us one short.

TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALISAIE_000_005<tab>That conniving braggart didn't so much as lift a finger for the Feat of Proof and wreaked havoc for the Feat of Ice. He can't have more than three keystones at most.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_006<tab>He may think he can simply steal what he needs to win, but he's sorely mistaken. I will be taking back what is mine─this I swear!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_007<tab>I fear that reclaiming your keystone may not be enough─that is, if Bakool Ja Ja's unleashing of Valigarmanda is any indication.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_008<tab>Using his lead, I anticipate that he will move to obtain the remaining keystones before disrupting his rivals' attempts.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_009<tab>We may all find ourselves being forced to take from one another.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_009<tab>I can't say I'd be comfortable with that.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_010<tab>But neither will I surrender my claim to the throne so easily. If it's for the sake of preserving the happiness of my people, I'll do what I must!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_011<tab>The last two keystones we require are those of the Lay of Repast and the Lay of the Brotherhood.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_012<tab>The former depicts the cessation of hostilities between the Mamool Ja and Xbr'aal in the forests of Yak T'el. Specifically near a village called Iq Br'aax.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_013<tab>That's where I was born, if you recall. I haven't been back there since Papa took me in when I was a baby.

TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_014<tab>Where the Lay of the Brotherhood takes place, however, is unclear. In the saga, it is said that a foreign explorer came seeking an audience with the Dawnservant...but little more than that.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_015<tab>Eorzea has a similar tale─the explorer Ketenramm befriended a two-headed king known as the Autarch before commencing his travels across Tural.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_016<tab>He journeyed here several times afterwards, but was ultimately lost at sea. At least, that is the commonly held belief.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_017<tab>Your two-headed king certainly sounds like Papa. So this Ketenramm fellow must have come to Tuliyollal!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_018<tab>But if he indeed arrived some eighty years ago, the capital may not have been built yet. Vestiges of Yok Huy architecture notwithstanding.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_020<tab>Wait─you said “Autarch,” didn't you? Then Ketenramm must have met the Dawnservant in <var 1A 02 /var>Mamook<var 1A 01 /var>!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_021<tab>Mamook... Is that a city?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_022<tab>One of the grandest in Tural, once upon a time─and the seat of the Mamool Ja's homeland. It too lies in Yak T'el, not far from Iq Br'aax.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALISAIE_100_022<tab>Then all things considered, Yak T'el seems the obvious choice for our next destination.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_023<tab>From here, the safest method of travel is by dirigible. We should make for the landing once our preparations are complete.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_024<tab>W-We're riding in one of Koana's balloons? ...They can't be any worse than ships, can they?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_030<tab>I-It'll be fine...just...fine...
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_035<tab>Yak T'el... Where the Yok Huy dreamt of the golden city...
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_040<tab>Ready to leave when you are.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_045<tab>How exciting! The design of Turali dirigibles intrigues me. I must note how they perform compared to Eorzean airships...
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALISAIE_000_050<tab>For as much as I wish we could ignore him, Bakool Ja Ja is a real threat. We can't afford to let our guard down.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_EMPLOYEESTERMINAL04897_000_055<tab>The next flight to Yak T'el will be leaving shortly. Passengers are asked to keep hands, legs, and luggage inside the dirigible at all times.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_056<tab>A-Are we sure that thing will stay in the air? ...All the way to Yak T'el!?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_057<tab>A-Are you ready!? Bags packed and, er, good-byes said!? There's no going back once we lift off!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_058<tab>N-Not that I'm nervous or anything. I'm just making sure that <var 1A 02 /var>you're<var 1A 01 /var> not nervous!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_059<tab>Oh, who am I kidding...my knees won't stop shaking. Hey, will you hold my hand? J-Just until I've settled my nerves.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_A1_000_001<tab>Of course.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_A1_000_002<tab>Maybe ask Erenville?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_061<tab>You're the nicest person I've ever met, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. I'll try not to crush your hand...
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_062<tab>That stick-in-the-mud!? He'd never let me live it down!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_MABLU_000_063<tab>There she is! Third Promise, wait just a moment!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_064<tab>Mablu and Tobli! Of course, of course─I'll wait as long as you need!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_MABLU_000_065<tab>Sorry to delay you, but we were able to discover the origin of Krile's earring!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_066<tab>Is that so?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_067<tab>You said before that it gained popularity in Yok Tural as a protective ward for travelers, correct?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_MABLU_000_068<tab>That's right! We tracked down the elderly merchant to whom first sales are attributed.

TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_MABLU_000_069<tab>According to him, the design imitates an accessory worn by a foreign mage he met at market some twenty years ago. Little did he know that charming taste of salt would prove to be a commercial triumph!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_070<tab>A foreign mage wearing this earring could only be Grandfather. Did the merchant happen to mention which market?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_TOBLI_000_071<tab>One in Yak T'el─to where it seems you are already bound.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_072<tab>What luck. Then I shall seek my next clue once we arrive.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_073<tab>Is it mere coincidence that brought my grandfather there? Or...
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALISAIE_000_074<tab>Yet another discovery to look forward to.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_075<tab>Thank you both for coming all this way.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_MABLU_000_076<tab>Anything for the Third Promise! Good luck with the rest of the rite!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_077<tab>Th-Thanks! I won't let you down. I've just got to board this dirigible and...and I'm as good as there!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_EMPLOYEESTERMINAL04897_000_078<tab>Last call for passengers to Yak T'el!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_MABLU_000_079<tab>...I really hope she wins.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_TOBLI_000_080<tab>Yak T'el will test her mettle, without a doubt.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_TOBLI_000_081<tab>The next Dawnservant must be willing to bear the full weight of this nation's history...no matter how heavy it may be.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_90<tab>Would it <var 1A 02 /var>kill<var 1A 01 /var> Erenville to give me the benefit of the doubt? Or the benefit of a second chance?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_91<tab>I can hardly fathom how difficult travel must have been before the Second Promise introduced dirigibles. Can you imagine having to walk all this way?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_92<tab>Well, that journey was delightful. The wind was fair and the vessel hardly rocked at all.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALISAIE_000_93<tab>Worry not─Krile and I will ensure our Promise doesn't wind up at the bottom of one of these cenotes.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_95<tab>With thicker vegetation comes reduced visibility. I advise you to keep someone in sight at all times.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_100<tab>See? No tumbles! ...Thanks to Krile and Alisaie, but it still counts.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_105<tab>For all of Erenville's insistence, I have yet to discover anything particularly blue about this forest.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_110<tab>Is that Iq Br'aax over there, I wonder?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALISAIE_000_115<tab>Take care not to get separated. I'd hate to lose you to this rampant undergrowth.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_120<tab>Good, everyone's accounted for.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_121<tab>Iq Br'aax is up ahead. Let's be on our way.

TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_WUKLAMAT_000_130<tab>Hah! I've fallen into High Tide Harbor enough times to be a professional diver─there's no way I'd fall into something like <var 1A 02 /var>this<var 1A 01 /var> on accident!
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_KRILE_000_135<tab>Are all cenotes this deep, I wonder?
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_140<tab>What's so blue about this forest? You'll see.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALISAIE_000_145<tab>Just so you know, I shall be very cross if you push me.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ALPHINAUD_000_150<tab>Erenville was not exaggerating about the cenotes. It would be a grueling ordeal to climb out of one.
TEXT_KINGMC101_04897_ERENVILLE_000_151<tab>Well, thankfully we made it here without incident. Let's not dally any longer.
